Line 1: Line 1: â
'''Richard Bozulich''' (born [[1936]]) is a famous author of [[Go (board game)|Go]] books in English.
+
'''Richard Bozulich''' (born [[1936]]) is a author of [[Go (board game)|Go]] books in English.
Richard Bozulich was born in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]]. He attended [[UCLA]] and in [[1966]] graduated from the [[University of California at Berkeley]] with a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] in [[mathematics]]. Bozulich had worked his way through college by dealing in highly technical used books and upon graduation decided to become a [[book publisher]]. He moved to Japan and in [[1968]] founded [[The Ishi Press]], a book and magazine publishing company that primarily published books about the game of [[Go (board game)|go]].
Richard Bozulich was born in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]]. He attended [[UCLA]] and in [[1966]] graduated from the [[University of California at Berkeley]] with a [[Bachelor of Arts|BA]] in [[mathematics]]. Bozulich had worked his way through college by dealing in highly technical used books and upon graduation decided to become a [[book publisher]]. He moved to Japan and in [[1968]] founded [[The Ishi Press]], a book and magazine publishing company that primarily published books about the game of [[Go (board game)|go]].
Line 5: Line 5:
Initally, Bozulich was mostly a translator and editor of existing Japanese-language go material. Ishi Press and [[Kiseido Publishing Company]] have now published many books written under Bozulich's own name.
Initally, Bozulich was mostly a translator and editor of existing Japanese-language go material. Ishi Press and [[Kiseido Publishing Company]] have now published many books written under Bozulich's own name.
â
Richard Bozulich has written or published more than one hundred books and magazine and newspaper articles about the game of go. He is the world's most prolific author of go books in English. Richard Bozulich is the publisher of [[Go World]] magazine. He had a regular [http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/columns/0001/ go column] in [[Yomiuri Shimbun|The Daily Yomiuri]], Japan's largest English-language newspaper. He lives in [[Chigasaki]], [[Japan]] and is a professor of [[math]], [[physics]] and [[chemistry]] at a local college. His father was from [[Zadar county]], [[Croatia]]. Richard Bozulich has five children.
+
Richard Bozulich has written or published more than one hundred books and magazine and newspaper articles about the game of go. He is the world's most prolific author of go books in English.{{fact}} Richard Bozulich is the publisher of [[Go World]] magazine. He had a regular [http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/columns/0001/ go column] in [[Yomiuri Shimbun|The Daily Yomiuri]], Japan's largest English-language newspaper. He lives in [[Chigasaki]], [[Japan]] and is a professor of [[math]], [[physics]] and [[chemistry]] at a local college. His father was from [[Zadar county]], [[Croatia]]. Richard Bozulich has five children.
